verses.verse: A Plea for Repentance (Hos 10.12; 12.6; Joel 2.13) Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God, for you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
(Mic 7.18, 19; Heb 13.15) Take words with you and return to the LORD; say to him, “Take away all guilt; accept that which is good, and we will offer the fruit (Gk Syr: Heb bulls) of our lips.
(Ps 10.14; Isa 31.1; Hos 5.13; 8.6; 13.2) Assyria shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses; we will say no more, ‘Our God,’ to the work of our hands. In you the orphan finds mercy.”
Assurance of Forgiveness (Isa 12.1; Zeph 3.17) I will heal their disloyalty; I will love them freely, for my anger has turned from them.
(Job 29.19; Isa 35.2; Mt 6.28) I will be like the dew to Israel; he shall blossom like the lily; he shall strike root like the forests of Lebanon. (Cn: Heb like Lebanon)
(Ps 52.8; Song 4.11) His shoots shall spread out; his beauty shall be like the olive tree and his fragrance like that of Lebanon.

(Ps 91.4; Ezek 17.23; Hos 2.21, 22) They shall again live beneath my (Heb his) shadow; they shall flourish as a garden; (Cn: Heb they shall grow grain) they shall blossom like the vine; their fragrance shall be like the wine of Lebanon.

(v 3|HOS 14:3; Isa 41.19; Ezek 17.23) O Ephraim, what have I (Or What more has Ephraim) to do with idols? It is I who answer and look after you. (Heb him) I am like an evergreen cypress; your fruit comes from me.

(Ps 107.43; Isa 1.28; 26.7; Acts 13.10) Those who are wise understand these things; those who are discerning know them. For the ways of the LORD are right, and the upright walk in them, but transgressors stumble in them.
